experience: You and Xavier both know Cliff Schertz, Dimitri Ponomareff, and 26 others
Xavier started at Swiftpage 4 years and 2 months before you did

Responsible for company-wide technical leadership, including long-term roadmap, and transformative and iterative technology and architecture across the platform, products, services, and the enterprise.  Substantial focus on unified APIs and low-code platform integrations.  Leading serverless workload architecture and technology on AWS.  Heading innovation framework to lead balanced innovation targets across the portfolio.

Driving next-gen SaaS development, including technology stack, architecture, API management, organizational development, cloud architecture, and integration.  Realizing vision through high-performing distributed development with Agile practices, technology acceleration, talent alignment and acquisition.  Driving technology change in the enterprise, including identity management and authorization, entitlement and provisioning integration, to transform the business to a digital subscription economy.  API development and management unlocking data and integrations across existing portfolio assets.

Heading ACT! product line development function, including new product, online services and SaaS development.  Multiyear cloud, mobile, web, and desktop development leadership, significant experience transitioning on-premise to cloud.  Spearheaded cloud platform adoption and assumed operations responsibilities during service growth with sustained high SLA.  Leader for SaaS technology, practices and organizational development.  Leader for agile architectural assessment and design practices.

Headed cross-product line (ACT! and SalesLogix) architects, institutionalized architecture and technology practices and governance for technology activities.  Leadership and contribution responsibilities for global technology work streams, including BI, CRM/ERP integration, OSS adoption.

Managed development of major product release including significant platform technology upgrades, several inline releases, and the first vertical product release.  Sole contributor to a custom development implementation leading to a successful close of the largest ($million) CRM account deal.
Helped pack food for displaced families.
